title: Email Verification Bypass by bruteforcing when setting up 2FA
vulnerability_information:
## Summary:
Hello team, I hope you are fine and doing well

when a user set ups his 2 Factor Authentication in his account  and verify his email ,i was able to bruteforce the email verification process . 

The confirmationCode is used for authentication of user's email and it can be brute forced. The code is only 6 digits long ,so it will not take much time to crack . (https://cloudnine.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/02/CrackPassword2.png)

After the victim's email confirmation code gets verified , the user can then set up his personal phone to victim's email and the victim will never be able to sign inside his account as he does not get the otp received in the attakers phone.(due to 2 fa)

## Steps To Reproduce:

  1. Request a confirmationCode in your email , enter any code
  2. Send this request to burpsuite intruder , and bruteforce the confirmationCode with any number of requests
  3. Out of all the response , one response will have a length around 373 (only response whose length is lesser than others), thus proving that was the correct confirmation code.

*Attackers Scenario*:

Attacker creates a account using victim's email ABC@gmail.com , Now attacker setups the 2FA  using brute force . Victim wants to join evernote , so he resets his password but he is unable to join since he does not have the 2FA codes . Thus he user is permanently unable to access evernote . It is a pre account takeover .

## Impact

The victim who wants to log inside or use forget password to recover his/her account in evernote will be locked out forever. Attacker did a pre account takeover.

activities.message:
Hi @cyberworlcload,

Although your finding might appear to be a security vulnerability, this requires an attacker to register before the victim and does not represent a real-world attack scenario since the attacker cannot know when the victim is going to register, or if they are going to register at all in the first place.
If you are able to demonstrate a practical exploitation scenario and show us the impact we will be happy to revaluate the report.
Therefore we're closing this submission as Informative which will not have an impact on your reputation or signal.

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we welcome future submissions.

Thanks,
@be_theodore e

Hello team , keeping the pre account takeover part aside . this has a additional vulnerability 


look at the report this way

No rate-limit in Two factor Authentication leads to bypass using bruteforce attack . here is the reference report (https://hackerone.com/reports/128777)

Impact:

If the attacker gets hold of the users password , he can log inside his account , setup 2fa and lock the user forever .
any updates?

Hi @cyberworlcload.

Thank you for your reply. If attacker gets hold of the users password then that is a completely different scenario in itself. Similar reports were submitted in the past and were closed as informative. Also please keep in mind every program has different internal policies that they treat every report differently.
We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Thanks,
@be_theodore

Hello team ,

What i have reported is a 2fa bypass which is very high concern security issue , and for all 2 fa bypass to work , the attacker gets hold of the users password . No company would want their security mechanisms to be bypassed as it would remove the effectiveness of the 2 fa security feature .
any updates?
any updates?

Hi @cyberworlcload,

Thank you for using the mediation service. We have reviewed the report again. Can you please provide a valid working PoC where you are able to send large number of requests and bypass the 2fa protection. This will help us expedite the triage process.

Thanks Again
@be_theodore

additional_data.old_title: Able to bruteforce confirmationCode allowing account lock via 2 FA ( pre account takeover)

activities.message:
Dear Sir/Ma'am,  I have attached a POC video below ,  i had also carried out this attack with thousands of requests and it still worked.

Please note: Once the attacker has the user's password , he can permanently lock a user by setting up the 2 fa. What makes this attack dangerous from normal password change is the fact that the user cannot use the forgot password feature to recover his account . All his important notes made by him/her will be lost forever  . Additional vulnerability is pre-account takeover .
Hi @cyberworlcload - I'm discussing this submission internally with the Evernote team. You will be updated as soon as there is additional information to share. Thanks for your patience!

Hello @cyberworlcload,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Thanks,
@be_theodore

Thank you so much for your response , can you please rename the report to as "Email Verification Bypass when setting up 2 FA" .  

**Summery**:  Attacker is able to bypass email verification using brute force which is used to enable 2FA. Because of this it also allows the attacker for confirming account with arbitrary email addresses. This same attack can also be used to carry out a pre account takeover. 

Reference reports:

https://hackerone.com/reports/1089205
https://hackerone.com/reports/649533

I think its very more greater than a low sensitive issue ,but as you have mentioned that severity are subject to change , i hope it will gets elevated .
any updates?

Hi @cyberworlcload,

Thank you for your patience, the Evernote team is still looking into this issue. I will make sure to update you whenever there is additional information to share.

Thanks again!

Regards,
@be_theodore

any updates? 

also did you read my comment on 18th November ?

additional_data.new_title: Email Verification Bypass by bruteforcing when setting up 2FA

activities.message:
Hi @cyberworlcload,

Thank you for your patience. We are working with the Evernote team and I will update you whenever there is additional information to share.

Thank you,
@be_theodore

Hello , thank you so much for the reward , 

Can you please confirm that email verification bypass is not a medium level vulnerability ?

Attacker is able to bypass email verification using brute force which is used to enable 2FA. Because of this it also allows the attacker for confirming account with arbitrary email addresses. This same attack can also be used to carry out a pre account takeover. 
Reference reports:
https://hackerone.com/reports/1089205
https://hackerone.com/reports/649533

For the same kind of vulnerability , you can see in the references above , its a medium level bug . 

Can you please provide me with a reasoning or a reference report who has the same bug in low level vulnerability?

Hi @cyberworlcload,

Thank you for your reply. I understand your concerns but the behaviour in the report is a low severity issue. Please understand that not every program is the same, and that each is very unique from one another. What may be accepted in one program, does not guarantee acceptance in another. This can be due to business impact, extra internal mitigations, etc. 
Also to carry out the attack in the report,  the adversary needs to know the victim's password first, which affects the severity of the report. And considering the pre-account takeover I have already mentioned the scope of this in a real life scenario. Hence the severity of the report will remain 'Low'.  Thank you for understanding. 

Regards,
@be_theodore
Thank you so much for the fast reply @be_theodore  , it was great working with you . Thanks again for the bounty
Hi @cyberworlcload, can you retest this issue?

Yes , follow the above steps , can you still bypass email verification , **it has not been fixed** . I have attached pictures below as proof. Also , i still think it is a medium bug , it is under low category for some reason , if you can change it , it would be great.

**Found one more bug**:  Your email is reflected in phone message conformation , attacker can inject his email payload for example : I tried with "call.us.7465475547@evernote.com ", now i can bruteforce email verification code and send sms to any user , user will think i am evernote employee as malicious attacker controlled email is reflected in the email . Please let me know if this bug is valid and should i make a new report for it.
Reflected in the  phone sms , not email , sorry for that .
Any updates?
Can you confitm the retest
Working on alternate fix
Revert report state to triaged from retesting
Hi @cyberworlcload, our team has shipped a fix which we think solves this issue so we'll be asking you for a retest.
Please disclose the report
Also please do remove my comment about @be_theodore while you disclose the report , He did an amazing job.

Thanks @cyberworlcload, I'm not sure which comment you are referring to. As for disclosing the report, that's something you have to request yourself using the Request disclosure action from the dropdown list.
Requesting disclosure, Please only include the report at the top, the rest is me explaining the report multiple times .
